marketNews.title: Indonesia CPI 1.71% YoY in October 2024, Lowest Since October 2021
marketNews.content: Indonesia's consumer price index (CPI) slowed to 1.71% year-on-year (YoY) in October 2024, the lowest level since October 2021, according to the Statistics Agency (BPS). The figure is down from 1.84% YoY in September 2024 and matches consensus expectations. Core inflation for October 2024 was 0.22% month-on-month (MoM) and 2.21% YoY, above the consensus forecast of 2.1% YoY. On a monthly basis, Indonesia recorded 0.08% MoM inflation (September 2024 showed a 0.12% MoM deflation), ending a five-month streak of monthly deflation and surpassing the consensus view of a flat reading. The monthly increase was driven mainly by personal care and other services, which rose 0.94% MoM, largely due to jewelry gold whose inflation contribution was 0.06 percentage points. On the same day, S&P Global reported that Indonesia's manufacturing Purchasing Managers' Index (PMI) stood at 49.2 in October 2024, unchanged for a second consecutive month and marking a fourth straight month of contraction. Output and new orders continued to fall amid a weak market, while geopolitical uncertainty has caused export sales to decline for an eighth consecutive month. Employment contracted for the third time in four months and confidence fell to a four-month low, well below historical trends.

marketNews.title: Constitutional Court orders removal of labour clusters from the Omnibus Law
marketNews.content: The Constitutional Court on Thursday, 31 October 2024 ruled that the labour-related clusters must be removed from the Omnibus Law on Job Creation. The Court ordered the House of Representatives and the government to draft a new Labour Law. The decision follows the Court’s partial granting of labor-union petitions covering seven major issues: foreign workers, fixed-term contracts, outsourcing, wages and minimum wage, leave, termination of employment, severance pay, wage-related compensation, and long-service awards.

marketNews.title: Economists forecast Indonesia Q3 2024 GDP growth at 5.0% YoY
marketNews.content: A Reuters poll of economists projected Indonesia’s economy to have grown 5.0% year-on-year in the third quarter of 2024, slightly below the 5.05% YoY recorded in the second quarter. The same poll expects quarterly growth of 1.6% in Q3, well below the 3.6% actually achieved in Q2, as export demand from China remains weak while domestic private-sector consumption stays solid.

marketNews.title: China manufacturing PMI climbs to 50.1 in October 2024
marketNews.content: China’s National Bureau of Statistics reported that the manufacturing Purchasing Managers' Index (PMI) rose to 50.1 in October 2024, up from 49.8 in September, slightly above the consensus level of 50. This marks the first time since April 2024 that China’s manufacturing PMI entered expansion territory, driven by an output increase to 52 (September 2024: 51.2), the highest in six months, supported by government stimulus measures.

marketNews.title: U.S. PCE inflation slows to 2.1% YoY in September 2024
marketNews.content: U.S. Personal Consumption Expenditures (PCE) price index eased to 2.1% YoY in September 2024 (down from 2.3% YoY in August), the lowest level since February 2021. On a monthly basis, PCE inflation was 0.2% MoM (August 2024: 0.1% MoM), matching consensus. The core PCE index, the Federal Reserve’s preferred long-term inflation gauge, rose to 0.3% MoM (August 2024: 0.2% MoM) and to 2.7% YoY, slightly above the consensus forecast of 2.6% YoY.

marketNews.title: Foreign tourist arrivals to Indonesia hit 1.3 million in September 2024
marketNews.content: The Statistics Agency reported that foreign tourist arrivals to Indonesia reached 1.28 million in September 2024, a 4.5% decline month-on-month but a 19.5% increase year-on-year. Over the first nine months of 2024, foreign arrivals rose 20.3% YoY to 10.4 million, representing 74.1% of the government’s 2024 target of 14 million.

tickerNews.title: MEDC posts 9M24 net profit down 41.7% YoY, below expectations
tickerNews.content: Medco Energi Internasional reported a net profit of US$72 million (-41.2% YoY, -43.6% QoQ) in the third quarter of 2024. The 9-month net profit therefore amounted to US$273 million (-41.7% YoY), well below expectations at roughly 68%–70% of the Stockbit/consensus FY24 forecast. Operating revenue grew 1.4% QoQ, driven by a 3.4% QoQ rise in oil sales and a 2.0% QoQ rise in gas sales, while gross-margin improved by 110 basis points QoQ to 37%. The weak net profit was pressured by a 63% QoQ decline in associate-company earnings and a 25.7% QoQ increase in tax expense.

tickerNews.title: ACES posts 9M24 net profit up 18% YoY, beating consensus
tickerNews.content: Aspirasi Hidup Indonesia reported a net profit of IDR 208 billion (+14% YoY, +30% QoQ) in Q3 2024, bringing 9-month net profit to IDR 574 billion (+18% YoY), beating expectations at roughly 67% of the FY24 consensus (seasonal 9-month profit historically 53-64%). The Q3 profit was driven by: (1) still-high revenue growth (+13% YoY, -2% QoQ); (2) gross-margin remaining around 48%; and (3) operating-margin expansion to 13.1% (+47 bps YoY, +338 bps QoQ) from operating leverage. Ex-post, excluding other income and currency losses, operating profit rose 33% YoY and 58% QoQ to IDR 260 billion in Q3 2024.

tickerNews.title: SSIA posts 9M24 net profit up 339% YoY
tickerNews.content: Surya Semesta Internusa recorded a net profit of IDR 123 billion (+2% QoQ, +339% YoY) in Q3 2024, resulting in a 9-month net profit of IDR 228 billion (versus a loss of IDR 24 billion in 9M 2023). The improvement stemmed from a 29% YoY (22% QoQ) revenue increase and a gross-margin expansion of 970 bps YoY (1 150 bps QoQ), driven by Industrial Estate Development sales of IDR 288 billion (2Q 2024: IDR 32 billion; 3Q 2023: IDR 48 billion). Operating profit rose to IDR 343 billion (+212% QoQ, +173% YoY).

tickerNews.title: CPIN 9M24 net profit down 11% YoY, below expectations
tickerNews.content: Charoen Pokphand Indonesia posted a net profit of IDR 619 billion (-52% QoQ, -41% YoY) in Q3 2024, resulting in a 9-month net profit of IDR 2.4 trillion (-11% YoY), below our estimate at 63% of the FY24 consensus but still matching the broader consensus at 74% of FY24. The Q3 profit decline was driven by a sharp contraction in operating profit across almost all segments except Feed. DOC segment operating profit fell to IDR 66 billion (-81% QoQ, -77% YoY). The Broiler segment posted an operating loss of IDR 235 billion (2Q 2024: profit IDR 585 billion; 3Q 2023: loss IDR 59 billion). Processed Chicken turned to a modest profit of IDR 14 billion (2Q 2024: loss IDR 82 billion; 3Q 2023: profit IDR 429 billion) after a streak of quarterly losses since Q4 2023. The Feed segment, however, saw operating profit rise 29% QoQ to IDR 1.1 trillion.

tickerNews.title: MAIN 9M24 net profit down 67% QoQ, +684% YoY
tickerNews.content: Malindo Feedmill reported a net profit of IDR 67 billion (-67% QoQ, -62% YoY) in Q3 2024, bringing 9-month profit to IDR 359 billion (+684% YoY). The profit decline was caused by weaker operating margins across most segments except Feed and Food & Poultry Processing. DOC segment operating profit fell to IDR 47 billion (-69% QoQ, -69% YoY). The Broiler segment posted an operating loss of IDR 82 billion (2Q 2024: loss IDR 2 billion; 3Q 2023: loss IDR 67 billion). Food & Poultry Processing recorded a loss of IDR 7 billion (2Q 2024: loss IDR 14 billion; 3Q 2023: loss IDR 9 billion), the smallest loss since 2023. Feed segment operating profit grew 14% QoQ to IDR 169 billion (-24% YoY).

tickerNews.title: NISP 9M24 net profit up 25% YoY
tickerNews.content: Bank OCBC NISP posted a net profit of IDR 1.4 trillion (+17% QoQ, +44% YoY) in Q3 2024, taking 9-month profit to IDR 3.8 trillion (+25% YoY). The result was driven by a 71% QoQ rise in non-interest income to IDR 314 billion (+40% YoY) and a 71% QoQ increase in non-operating income to IDR 373 billion (2Q 2024: IDR 171 billion; 3Q 2023: IDR 4 billion), the latter reflecting a discount received in the acquisition of PT Bank Commonwealth. Net interest income grew 8% QoQ and 15% YoY to IDR 2.9 trillion, lifting 9-month NII to IDR 8.1 trillion (+10% YoY). Net interest margin was 4.4% in Q3 and 9M. Operating expenses rose 16% QoQ and 41% YoY to IDR 1.8 trillion, giving a 9-month operating expense total of IDR 4.7 trillion (+25% YoY). Gross NPL improved to 1.8% (2Q 2024: 2.0%, 3Q 2023: 1.9%).

tickerNews.title: SMGR 9M24 net loss deepens to IDR 218 billion
tickerNews.content: Semen Indonesia reported a net loss of IDR 218 billion (-74% YoY) in Q3 2024, but the quarter’s profit surged 7.4-fold QoQ due to a low-base effect. The 9-month loss narrowed to IDR 720 billion (-58% YoY), far below expectations at only 36% of the FY24 consensus. The decline was caused by a 7% YoY drop in revenue to IDR 9.9 trillion (-23% QoQ) while gross-margin fell to 21.8% (2Q 2024: 20.5%; 3Q 2023: 28.5%).

tickerNews.title: INTP 9M24 net profit up 9.4% YoY
tickerNews.content: Indocement Tunggal Prakarsa posted a net profit of IDR 621 billion (+216% QoQ, +9.4% YoY) in Q3 2024, delivering a 9-month profit of IDR 1.1 trillion (-17% YoY) that beat the consensus at roughly 68% of the FY24 estimate (historically 61% of FY). Revenue grew 29% QoQ to IDR 5.2 trillion (4.8% YoY) and 13.3 trillion for the 9-month period (+3% YoY). The surge was driven by a 5.5 million-ton (-36% QoQ, +9.5% YoY) volume increase, supported by the acquisition of Semen Grobogan. Despite a 4% YoY and 5% QoQ drop in average selling price, the gross-margin rose to 34.3% (3Q 2023: 33.4%; 2Q 2024: 27.6%).

tickerNews.title: INKP 9M24 net loss of US$226 million
tickerNews.content: Indah Kiat Pulp & Paper reported a 9-month net loss of US$226 million (-30% YoY) caused by a US$67 million foreign-exchange loss. Operating profit remained positive at US$529 million (-15% YoY) with a 10-basis-point decline in margin, while gross-margin rose 10 bps to 33.1% despite a 10% YoY revenue decline offset by a 10% YoY drop in cost of sales. The 9-month operating profit rose 38% YoY to US$58 million, and gross-margin increased 250 bps to 7.6%.

tickerNews.title: TKIM 9M24 net loss of US$103 million
tickerNews.content: Pabrik Kertas Tjiwi Kimia reported a 9-month net loss of US$103 million (-23% YoY) driven by a US$16 million foreign-exchange loss. Operating profit was US$58 million (+38% YoY) and gross-margin rose 310 bps to 15.4% after a 10% YoY drop in cost of sales that outpaced a 7% YoY revenue decline.

tickerNews.title: UNVR 3Q24 performance below expectations
tickerNews.content: UNVR reported that its 3Q 2024 performance deteriorated, missing expectations, as the consumer-goods group’s sales of cold-medicine (Sido Muncul) fell and the company’s overall revenue fell short of forecasts, reflecting a down-trading trend among consumers. The article links to a Stockbit commentary that discusses the company’s solid revenue growth in key segments.

tickerNews.title: SIDO 9M24 sales decline amid down-trading
tickerNews.content: SIDO reported a decline in sales of its cold-medicine product line, leading to 9M24 results below expectations. The shortfall is attributed to down-trading among consumers.

tickerNews.title: TLKM ARPU declines amid weakening consumer purchasing power
tickerNews.content: TLKM’s average revenue per user (ARPU) fell, reflecting weaker consumer purchasing power, while the same trend was observed at PT Indosat Tbk (ISAT).

tickerNews.title: ISAT ARPU decline
tickerNews.content: ISAT’s average revenue per user (ARPU) fell, mirroring the broader down-trading pressure on consumer spending.

tickerNews.title: TSPC reports solid revenue growth in key segments
tickerNews.content: Tempo Scan Pacific ($TSPC) recorded solid revenue growth in its key segments, as detailed in the Stockbit Commentary and the accompanying Unboxing video. The company’s revenue expansion was highlighted in the Stockbit post and the linked Unboxing video.

tickerNews.title: SMSM interim dividend 2024 announced
tickerNews.content: Selamat Sempurna (SMSM) announced an interim dividend for the 2024 fiscal year of IDR 35 per share, totalling IDR 201.5 billion. The dividend is payable on 21 November 2024 after the record-date on 7 November 2024. Based on the 1 November closing price of IDR 1,930, the implied dividend yield is about 1.8%. This is the third interim dividend for 2024, following IDR 25 per share in May and IDR 35 per share in August.

tickerNews.title: TEBE interim dividend 2024 announced
tickerNews.content: Dana Brata Luhur (TEBE) announced an interim dividend of IDR 20 per share, amounting to IDR 25.7 billion. The dividend is payable on 21 November 2024 after the record-date on 8 November 2024. Using the 1 November closing price of IDR 655 per share, the implied dividend yield is about 3.0%. The company previously paid interim dividends of IDR 15 per share in July 2024 and August 2024.

tickerNews.title: Down-trading pressure on consumer and telecom stocks
tickerNews.content: UNVR, SIDO, TLKM and ISAT were cited as consumer-goods and telecom companies whose sales and average revenue per user (ARPU) have fallen amid a broader down-trading trend that is eroding the purchasing power of Indonesian consumers.
